intro: Eminium koenenianum, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Eminium koenenianum is valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
